name: Levro
headline: Multicurrency account & international payments for businesses
description:
Levro is a multicurrency account and global payments platform for businesses. We help US & international companies hold, convert, and pay 30+ currencies. Our exchange at rates are 40-90% lower than banks and FX services like Wise. We also offer free currency risk management, recipient onboarding, automated multicurrency reconciliation, and wire tracking.

If you have international customers, employee payroll, vendors, or bulk payouts to different countries please send us a note! founders@levro.com
tags: industry:fintech; industry:payments; industry:finance; industry:b2b; industry:international; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Cathy Han, Founder
founders.description:
Cathy Han is the Co-founder & CEO of Levro, a multicurrency neobank for businesses. Levro provides US accounts that hold up to 34 currencies to help companies pay teams, vendors, and receive revenue from customers internationally.

Prior to Levro, Cathy co-founded 42 Technologies (YC W14), a big data company with retail customers around the globe. Cathy holds a Finance degree from the University of British Columbia & MBA from Harvard Business School.

founders.name: Abeer Agrawal, Founder
founders.description: Prior to Levro, Abeer was the Co-founder & CTO of Theorem (YC W14), a machine learning enabled hedge fund which he built to over $1bn+ in AUM. Abeer holds degrees in Electrical & Computer Engineering and Computational Finance from Carnegie Mellon University.

Streamline your payment workflows with automated data entry, flexible approval processes, easy to use payments, and simple reconciliation.

Why Levro
### Scale your business with Levro
#### Globally scalable solutions, reliability, and security for your payment workflows.
United Platform
Using Levro's unified experience, you can automate and simplify your payments, integrate it with the tools you use, and ensure peace of mind with robust controls and approvals.‍
Easy To Set Up and Secure
An easy onboarding experience makes it easy for you to transition from your existing tools, set up processes, and send payments quickly. Built on solutions following security best practices including SOC2 (Unit) / ISO 27001 (CurrencyCloud).
FDIC Insurance2
FDIC insurance2 is available for funds on deposits in USD accounts offered through Thread Bank; Members FDIC.
Transparent Pricing
Levro delivers modern payments solutions with a simple, transparent cost structure so there's no surprise charges. 
Customers
#### Why Customers Love Us
[Read Case Studies ->](https://www.levro.com/</case-studies>)

Elise Polezel | CEO of HigherMe
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/644a834f2040ea6c30573a10/650851537eff201d675cc4c4_quote.svg)
Levro takes currency exchange off my plate and frees up mind share for real work. I love that I don’t have to think about currencies anymore

Anuraag Jain, CEO of Zensors

I’m always looking for a way to simplify contractor payments. I have been using Levro as much as possible and I’ve found it so easy to use!
Matthew Smith | Operations, Bounce
Get Started
Get started with a better way to handle payments
[Schedule Demo ->](https://www.levro.com/</contact-us>)
Frequently Asked Questions
What’s required to open a Levro account? 
For all applicants, we require an active United States entity with an EIN number. We may also ask for a copy of your certificate of incorporation and your EIN verification letter. 
If you reside outside of the United States, we will also require a valid passport and a recent bank statement, lease or utility bill to verify your home address. We do not require applicants to reside in the United States.
‍
How long does it take to open an account?
We can generally open an account in as little as 1 business day. If additional documents are required, then it will likely take longer.
Are there any minimum balance requirements?
No! We have no minimum balance requirement, however we do require that you activate your account by transacting at least once in the first 9 days.
I’m not located in the United States. Can I still open an account? 
Yes - we do not require that applicants reside in the United States, however you must have a US entity and have a strong US presence.
Who is eligible for a Levro account?
Businesses must be based in the United States with an active presence, have officers and/or beneficial owners who do not reside in an[ ineligible country,](https://www.levro.com/</currencies-and-countries>) and are not in a [restricted industry](https://www.levro.com/</restricted-industries>).
What fees are associated with the business bank account?
All accounts receive 10 free wires and 20 free local payments each month. For more information, please see our pricing [page](https://www.levro.com/</pricing>).
Can I link my business bank account to accounting software?
Yes, we are compatible with Quickbooks Online & Xero. If you have a different accounting software that you’d like to use, please let us know.
How can I deposit funds into my business bank account?
If you’re sending money from a US bank account, you can link your account via Plaid or send a wire or ACH transfer directly to your Levro account. If you’re depositing funds from an international bank account, we accept SWIFT payments, as well as local payments for CAD, GBP & EUR.
Is Levro a bank?
No – Levro is a technology company that partners with banks to offer a checking account specifically designed for international businesses. All USD and domestic transactions are processed through Blue Ridge Bank, N.A. and Thread Bank, Members FDIC, while international transactions are processed through Currencycloud, a Visa-owned company.
Are there any transaction limits or restrictions?
There is an outbound conversion limit of $500K, with a few other limits depending on the payment method and tier of the account. If you ever need to complete a large transaction, please reach out to us for assistance. There are no limits on inbound transactions.
Regarding restrictions, there are few restrictions on where you can send funds (outside of sanctioned countries) however we do restrict payments from some countries. The full list can be found [here](https://www.levro.com/</currencies-and-countries>).
Can I make international transactions from my business account?
Yes! Levro simplifies cross border and multi currency transactions. You can send payments to over 180 countries in over 30 different currencies. View our [currencies and countries page](https://www.levro.com/</currencies-and-countries>) for more information.
What security measures are in place to protect my account?
Security is our top priority. Levro leverages industry best practices and solutions to protect your data and funds. For more information, view our [Safety page](https://www.levro.com/</security-at-levro>).
Are my funds covered under the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)?
Yes – Levro offers FDIC pass-through, insurance-eligible accounts available through Blue Ridge Bank, N.A., and Thread Bank, Members FDIC.
‍

1 Daily cut-off times apply and other limits apply. Please refer to the [Levro Deposit Account Agreement](https://www.levro.com/<https:/www.levro.com/business-deposit-account-agreement-thread>) for details on banking services provided by Thread Bank; Member FDIC. Annual Percentage Yield (APY) on accounts provided by Thread Bank is effective as of 12/19/2024. For balances between $100,000 - $199,999.99 the account earns 0.81% APY. For balances between $200,000 - $999,999.99 the account earns 1.62% APY. For balances between $1,000,000 - $2,999,999.99 the account earns 3.23% APY. For balances over $3,000,000 the account earns 3.27% APY. The given APYs are based on a variable rate and may change at any time. Fees may affect earnings on the account.
2 Levro is a financial technology company, not a bank. Banking services provided by Thread Bank; Members FDIC.. Deposits are FDIC-insured through Thread Bank, Member FDIC. Your deposits qualify for up to $3,000,000 in FDIC insurance coverage when placed at program banks in the Thread Bank deposit sweep program. Your deposits at each program bank become eligible for FDIC insurance up to $250,000, inclusive of any other deposits you may already hold at the bank in the same ownership capacity. You can access the terms and conditions of the sweep program at <https://thread.bank/sweep-disclosure/> and a list of program banks at <https://thread.bank/program-banks/>. Please contact customerservice@thread.bank with questions regarding the sweep program.
The Levro Visa Debit Card is issued by Thread Bank; Members FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa USA Inc. Your funds are FDIC insured up to $250,000 through Thread Bank; Members FDIC. Payment services in the United States are provided by Visa Global Services Inc. (VGSI), a licensed money transmitter (NMLS ID 181032) in the states listed [here](https://www.levro.com/<https:/usa.visa.com/legal/visa-global-services-licenses.html>). VGSI is licensed as a money transmitter by the New York Department of Financial Services. Mailing address: 900 Metro Center Blvd, Mailstop 1Z, Foster City, CA 94404. VGSI is also a registered Money Services Business (“MSB”) with FinCEN and a registered Foreign MSB with FINTRAC. For live customer support contact VGSI at (888) 733-0041. Payment and e-money services are provided by The Currency Cloud Limited. Please refer to [Levro Foreign Exchange Services Addendum](https://www.levro.com/<https:/www.levro.com/levro-foreign-exchange-services-addendum>) for details. Registered in England No. 06323311. Registered Office: Stewardship Building 1st Floor, 12 Steward Street London E1 6FQ. The Currency Cloud Limited is authorized by the Financial Conduct Authority under the Electronic Money Regulations 2011 for the issuing of electronic money (FRN: 900199) and subject to the [Currencycloud Terms of Use](https://www.levro.com/<https:/www.currencycloud.com/legal/terms/>).
* Accounts are eligible for pass-through deposit insurance only to the extent pass-through insurance is permitted by the rules and regulations of the FDIC, and if the requirements for pass-through insurance aresatisfied. There may be a risk that pass-through deposit insurance is not available because conditions have not been satisfied. In such cases, funds may not be fully insured in the event the insured depository institution where the funds have been deposited were to fail.
3 Additional fees imposed by card networks may apply to all international transactions using the Card. Please refer to [Levro Deposit Account Agreement](https://www.levro.com/<https:/www.levro.com/business-deposit-account-agreement-thread>) and [Levro Visa® Debit Cardholder Agreement](https://www.levro.com/<https:/www.levro.com/visa-cardholder-agreement-thread>) for products issued by Thread Bank"
4 The Levro Visa® Debit Card is issued by Thread Bank; Members FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa U.S.A. Inc.
In order to receive information about your Personal Data, the purposes and the parties the Data is shared with, contact Levro. For more information and to understand your rights, you can also view the complete version of this [privacy policy](https://www.levro.com/</privacy>).

All USD and domestic transactions are processed through Blue Ridge Bank, N.A. and Thread Bank, Members FDIC, while international transactions are processed through Currencycloud, a Visa-owned company.
Are there any transaction limits or restrictions?
There is an outbound conversion limit of $500K, with a few other limits depending on the payment method and tier of the account. If you ever need to complete a large transaction, please reach out to us for assistance. There are no limits on inbound transactions.
Regarding restrictions, there are few restrictions on where you can send funds (outside of sanctioned countries) however we do restrict payments from some countries. The full list can be found here⟨16⟩.
Can I make international transactions from my business account?
Yes! Levro simplifies cross border and multi currency transactions. You can send payments to over 180 countries in over 30 different currencies. View our currencies and countries page⟨16⟩ for more information.
What security measures are in place to protect my account?
Security is our top priority. Levro leverages industry best practices and solutions to protect your data and funds. For more information, view our Safety page⟨12⟩.
Are my funds covered under the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)?
Yes – Levro offers FDIC pass-through, insurance-eligible accounts available through Blue Ridge Bank, N.A., and Thread Bank, Members FDIC.
‍

1 Daily cut-off times apply and other limits apply. Please refer to the Levro Deposit Account Agreement⟨28⟩ for details on banking services provided by Thread Bank; Member FDIC. Annual Percentage Yield (APY) on accounts provided by Thread Bank is effective as of 12/19/2024. For balances between $100,000 - $199,999.99 the account earns 0.81% APY. For balances between $200,000 - $999,999.99 the account earns 1.62% APY. For balances between $1,000,000 - $2,999,999.99 the account earns 3.23% APY. For balances over $3,000,000 the account earns 3.27% APY. The given APYs are based on a variable rate and may change at any time. Fees may affect earnings on the account.
2 Levro is a financial technology company, not a bank. Banking services provided by Thread Bank; Members FDIC.. Deposits are FDIC-insured through Thread Bank, Member FDIC. Your deposits qualify for up to $3,000,000 in FDIC insurance coverage when placed at program banks in the Thread Bank deposit sweep program. Your deposits at each program bank become eligible for FDIC insurance up to $250,000, inclusive of any other deposits you may already hold at the bank in the same ownership capacity. You can access the terms and conditions of the sweep program at <https://thread.bank/sweep-disclosure/> and a list of program banks at <https://thread.bank/program-banks/>. Please contact customerservice@thread.bank with questions regarding the sweep program.
The Levro Visa Debit Card is issued by Thread Bank; Members FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa USA Inc. Your funds are FDIC insured up to $250,000 through Thread Bank; Members FDIC. Payment services in the United States are provided by Visa Global Services Inc. (VGSI), a licensed money transmitter (NMLS ID 181032) in the states listed here⟨29⟩. VGSI is licensed as a money transmitter by the New York Department of Financial Services. Mailing address: 900 Metro Center Blvd, Mailstop 1Z, Foster City, CA 94404. VGSI is also a registered Money Services Business (“MSB”) with FinCEN and a registered Foreign MSB with FINTRAC. For live customer support contact VGSI at (888) 733-0041. Payment and e-money services are provided by The Currency Cloud Limited. Please refer to Levro Foreign Exchange Services Addendum⟨30⟩ for details. Registered in England No. 06323311. Registered Office: Stewardship Building 1st Floor, 12 Steward Street London E1 6FQ. The Currency Cloud Limited is authorized by the Financial Conduct Authority under the Electronic Money Regulations 2011 for the issuing of electronic money (FRN: 900199) and subject to the Currencycloud Terms of Use⟨31⟩.
* Accounts are eligible for pass-through deposit insurance only to the extent pass-through insurance is permitted by the rules and regulations of the FDIC, and if the requirements for pass-through insurance aresatisfied. There may be a risk that pass-through deposit insurance is not available because conditions have not been satisfied. In such cases, funds may not be fully insured in the event the insured depository institution where the funds have been deposited were to fail.
3 Additional fees imposed by card networks may apply to all international transactions using the Card. Please refer to Levro Deposit Account Agreement⟨28⟩ and Levro Visa® Debit Cardholder Agreement⟨32⟩ for products issued by Thread Bank"
4 The Levro Visa® Debit Card is issued by Thread Bank; Members FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa U.S.A. Inc.
In order to receive information about your Personal Data, the purposes and the parties the Data is shared with, contact Levro. For more information and to understand your rights, you can also view the complete version of this privacy policy⟨33⟩.

generated_description:
### Levro: Simplifying International Payments for Businesses

**Overview**  
Levro is a financial technology company that launched in 2021 and quickly found its footing as a member of Y Combinator's Batch S21. Based in San Francisco, Levro specializes in providing multicurrency accounts and global payments solutions tailored for businesses. With a lean team of 12, Levro is on a mission to revolutionize how companies make international payments.

**Core Offering**  
Levro allows businesses to hold, convert, and pay in over 30 currencies. They proudly claim that their exchange rates are significantly more favorable—40-90% lower—than traditional banks and renowned FX services like Wise. This means businesses can save substantial costs while managing their global transactions. 

In addition to competitive rates, Levro also offers:
- **Currency Risk Management**: Free tools to mitigate against currency fluctuations.
- **Recipient Onboarding**: Streamlining the process of getting recipients set up to receive payments.
- **Automated Multicurrency Reconciliation**: Keeping financial records organized without the manual hassle.
- **Wire Tracking**: Transparency at each step of the payment process.

**Why Choose Levro?**
For businesses with international customers, employees, or vendors, Levro offers a seamless experience. Their platform is not just about payments; it’s built around automation and integration, designed to simplify workflows and allow you to focus on what really matters—growing your business.

**Unique Selling Points**  
1. **Significantly Reduced Costs**: Levro's lower exchange rates can translate into massive savings for companies that operate globally.
2. **User-Friendly Interface**: Automation features make it easy to send bulk payments, ensuring all processes are user-friendly.
3. **Simple Onboarding**: Levro's setup process is designed to be quick and straightforward, enabling companies to begin using their services within days.
4. **Security and Compliance**: Built on industry security standards like SOC 2 and ISO 27001, Levro prioritizes customer data and funds security.

**Integration and Support**  
Levro integrates seamlessly with accounting software like Quickbooks and Xero, helping businesses maintain accurate financial records without extra effort. They provide extensive resources, including a blog and case studies showcasing how they make life easier for companies of all sizes.

**Team and Vision**  
With Dalton Caldwell as their Group Partner at Y Combinator, Levro brings considerable expertise to the fintech space. The team, though small, is driven by a clear mission: to make multicurrency accounts and international payments not just accessible but valuable for businesses across the globe.

**Contact and More Information**  
If you’re curious about how Levro can streamline your business payments and help you save costs, head to their website at [levro.com](https://www.levro.com) or reach out directly at founders@levro.com.  

In a world where international transactions can be a hurdle, Levro is here to remove the barriers, letting you focus on conquering new markets instead of wrestling with currency exchange.
